p: Plant lectins have also been showed to potently block the entry of SARS-CoV into the cells. Keyaerts et al. (2007) showed that lectins isolated from many different plants showed a promising anti-SARS-CoV activity with EC 50 ranging from 0.45 to >100 μg/mL and CC 50 value ranging from 50 to 100 μg/mL. Among all of them, the highest anti-coronavirus activity through cytopathic effects was reported among mannose-binding lectins isolated from Allium porrum with a selectivity index of >222. The study revealed that apart from interference with viral replication during the viral life cycle, the lectins seemed to inhibit viral entry to the cell.
